title: Example model uncertainty and sensitivity
text: can use Rcentury package assess uncertainties (aka errors) modelâ€™s parameters contribute overall uncertainty output. general, many models possible derive approximate analytical expressions n-error error propagation using Taylor expansions, involves calculating analytical n-order derivatives. However, approach quickly becomes cumbersome impractical number parameters grows high , especially, function evaluate complex non-linear like CENTURY. Therefore, determine error propagation CENTURY model turn much simpler Monte Carlo numerical approach, consists feeding model input parameters interests vary randomly model run following given distribution known mean variance. sake simplicity demonstrate perform uncertainty propagation analysis uncertainty soil texture (.e.Â clay, silt sand) , keeping parameters model fixed. case, model run draw random proportion values three parameters, calculate CENTURY model values save output. done many times derive reliable confidence intervals output. Texture always given set 3 proportions add 1 always, need specify random distribution accounts property. Consequently, turn Dirichlet distributions, allow us model probability distributions outcomes categorical events, total probability adds one. details, see Annex .

title: Example model uncertainty and sensitivity
text: example use forest data CENTURY example files. create temporary directory move necessary files (ASCII data files executables). simulation carried -called ğšğšğš”ğš.ğŸ·ğŸ¶ğŸ¶\texttt{duke.100} example, though site .  need package ğšğš¡ğšğš›ğšŠğ™³ğš’ğšœğšğš›\texttt{extraDistr}, available CRAN, provide us random-number generator Dirichlet distribution. also load Rcentury package.  intend model propagation uncertainty , sensibility , texture parameters. parameters included ğšğšğš”ğš.ğŸ·ğŸ¶ğŸ¶\texttt{duke.100} site file, read ğšŒğšğš—ğšğšğš›ğš¢_ğŸºğŸ½.ğšğš¡ğš\texttt{century_47.exe} execution. Consequently, use package functions ğš›ğšğšŠğš_ğšœğš’ğšğš.ğš\texttt{read_site.R} ğš ğš›ğš’ğšğš_ğšœğš’ğšğš.ğš\texttt{write_site.R} read site data write back onto disk simulation step.
code: from_dir <- system.file("extdata/4.forest",  package = "Rcentury") to_dir <- tempdir() invisible(file.copy(from_dir, to_dir, overwrite = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)) path_exe <- system.file("bin/windows",  package = "Rcentury") century_exe <- file.path(path_exe, "century_47.exe") list100_exe <- file.path(path_exe, "list100_47.exe") to_dir <- file.path(to_dir, "4.forest") invisible(file.copy(century_exe, to_dir, overwrite = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)) invisible(file.copy(list100_exe, to_dir, overwrite = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)) # install.packages("extraDistr") library(extraDistr) #> Warning: package 'extraDistr' was built under R version 4.4.3 library(Rcentury) # site <- site2 <- read_site(to_dir, "duke.100") x <- site$`site and control`$df sand <- x$value[x$field == "SAND"] silt <- x$value[x$field == "SILT"] clay <- x$value[x$field == "CLAY"] alpha <- dirichlet_params(c(sand, silt, clay), c(NA, .01, NA))  nsimu <- 10 df <- list() for (i in 1:nsimu) {      # Random Dirichlet triplet.   texture_random <- rdirichlet(1, alpha)      # Save <site>.100 file.   x <- site2$`site and control`$df   x$value[x$field == "SAND"] <- texture_random[1]   x$value[x$field == "SILT"] <- texture_random[1]   x$value[x$field == "CLAY"] <- texture_random[1]   site2$`site and control`$df <- x   write_site(site2, to_dir, "duke.100", overwrite = TRUE)      df[[i]] <- century_run(to_dir, "duke.sch", "res.bin", "res.lis", "outvars.txt", verbose = FALSE)   invisible(file.remove(file.path(to_dir, c("res.bin", "res.lis")))) }

what: Annex: How to draw multivariate proportions
title: Example model uncertainty and sensitivity
text: means proportions fixed simulations. f(x1,â€¦,xK;Î±1,â€¦,Î±K)=1B(ğ›‚)âˆ=1KxiÎ±iâˆ’1f(x_1, \dots, x_K; \alpha_1, \dots, \alpha_K) = \frac{1}{B(\boldsymbol{\alpha})} \prod_{=1}^K x_i^{\alpha_i - 1} : B(ğ›‚)=âˆ=1KÎ“(Î±i)Î“(âˆ‘=1KÎ±i)B(\boldsymbol{\alpha}) = \frac{\prod_{=1}^K \Gamma(\alpha_i)}{\Gamma(\sum_{=1}^K \alpha_i)} : xiâˆˆ[0,1],âˆˆ{1,â€¦,K}x_i \[0, 1], \quad \text{} \\{1, \dots, K\} well : âˆ‘=1Kxi=1\sum_{=1}^K x_i = 1 mean xix_i , : E[xi]=Î±iâˆ‘j=1KÎ±jE[x_i] = \frac{\alpha_i}{\sum_{j=1}^K \alpha_j} expression variance : Var[xi]=Î±iÌƒâ‹…(1âˆ’Î±iÌƒ)Î±0âˆ’1Var[x_i] = \frac{\tilde{\alpha_i}\cdot(1-\tilde{\alpha_i})}{\alpha_0-1} : Î±iÌƒ=Î±iÎ±0\tilde{\alpha_i}=\frac{\alpha_i}{\alpha_0} can use two expressions calculate Î±j\alpha_j values given four parameters E[xi]E[x_i] E[Vi]E[V_i]. Rcentury package provides function, called ğšğš’ğš›ğš’ğšŒğš‘ğš•ğšğš_ğš™ğšŠğš›ğšŠğš–ğšœ.ğš\texttt{dirichlet_params.R}, can calculate Î±j\alpha_j values means E[xi] âˆˆ{1,â€¦,K}E[x_i]\text{ } \\{1, \dots, K\} one single variance value Var[xj]Var[x_j] known. example, K=3K=3 E[x1]=.35E[x_1]=.35, E[x2]=.12E[x_2]=.12, E[x3]=.53E[x_3]=.53 Var[x2]=.17Var[x_2]=.17, can easily generate sequences Dirichlet-distributed triplets.
code: alpha <- dirichlet_params(c(.35, .12, .53), c(NA, .042, NA)) x <- rdirichlet(10000, alpha) par(mfrow = c(1, 3)) hist(x[, 1], xlab = "", main = "First component") hist(x[, 2], xlab = "", main = "Second component") hist(x[, 3], xlab = "", main = "Third component") par(mfrow = c(1,1))

title: Authors and Citation
text: First Last. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Last F (2025). Rcentury: Package (One Line, Title Case). R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://emf-creaf.github.io/Rcentury/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Rcentury: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)},   author = {First Last},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://emf-creaf.github.io/Rcentury/}, }

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: CENTURY soil model bio-chemistry ecosystem model simulates long-term dynamics carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus, sulfur various terrestrial ecosystems. can used predict climate land management practices impact change soil health carbon sequestration. model works splitting soil organic matter three different carbon pools based decomposition rates. rates influenced differently soil temperature, moisture, texture, cultivation practices. CENTURY soil model available download https://www.soilcarbonsolutionscenter.com/people Fortran 4.7 version. can used stand-alone software run Windows command-prompt console. able execute CENTURY software series ASCII files must also prepared advance, read CENTURY run. files include: set 11 option files extension â€˜.100â€™, containing large set parameters. name files fixed. Single site file, also extension â€˜.100â€™, containing site-specific parameters. name file can chosen . Weather file, extension â€˜.wthâ€™, includes monthly data precipitation, minimum maximum temperature site. Schedule file, extension â€˜.schâ€™, details timing sequence events simulation. Editing input files individually extremely tedious challenging task, particularly goal apply CENTURY model large number different sites, /variety different climatic land management scenarios. manual process also highly susceptible errors, given vast number parameters must carefully adjusted. Therefore, significant improvement workflow able perform file operations within comprehensive software environment like R. goal package Rcentury thus run CENTURY 4.7 (version Fortran) R command window. includes preparing files (treatments, schedule, weather site characteristic), read load result files R session data.frame. Notice Rcentury implementation CENTURY equations R code. Rather, interface original CENTURY Fortran code R, guarantees calculations done via actual CENTURY code.

what: How to download and use CENTURY 4.7 as stand-alone software
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: Fortran version CENTURY 4.7 software can downloaded directly web site https://www.soilcarbonsolutionscenter.com, filling form. Two zip-files automatically downloaded, must unzipped folder choice. uncompressed folders contain necessary files, plus several user manuals examples. required files must kept folder CENTURY run. includes schedule, weather, site soil characteristic files (see numbered list ), well two compiled â€˜.exeâ€™ programs (â€˜century_47.exeâ€™ â€˜list100_47.exeâ€™). run CENTURY model must follow examples enclosed documentation.

previous_headings: How to download and use CENTURY 4.7 as stand-alone software
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: decide run CENTURY R session, may proceed follows. First, package Rcentury must install loaded R session. package publicly available github can easily fetched: , load usual R: ensures package functions available R session.
code: devtools::install_github("https://github.com/emf-creaf/Rcentury.git") #> Using GitHub PAT from the git credential store. #> Skipping install of 'Rcentury' from a github remote, the SHA1 (d6491322) has not changed since last install. #>   Use `force = TRUE` to force installation library(Rcentury) ## basic example code

what: How to prepare a CENTURY simulation with the Rcentury package
title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: three example simulations accompany CENTURY â€˜.zipâ€™ files. ASCII files required CENTURY software can read write functions provided Rcentury package: read_100/write_100: read/write CENTURY files extension â€™*.100â€™ save site files. read_site/write_site: read/write ers create input site files (extension â€˜.100â€™) CENTURY soil model. read_weather/write_weather: read_schedule/write_schedule: read/write *.sch CENTURY files. read_lis: functions allow us first read example files provided CENTURY software, change parameters write modified dataset disk. files available directory two â€˜.exeâ€™ files located, can run CENTURY â€˜century_run.Râ€™ function. Internally, â€˜century_run.Râ€™ runs sequentially â€˜century_47.exeâ€™ â€˜list100_47.exeâ€™, creating first â€˜.binâ€™ file ASCII â€˜.lisâ€™, finally read â€˜read_lis.Râ€™ function. output latter , finally, data.frame can manipulated analysed within R.

what: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session â€” century_run
title: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session â€” century_run
text: century_run

title: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session â€” century_run
code: century_run(   pathname = pathname,   schedule = schedule,   name_bin = name_bin,   name_lis = name_lis,   name_txt = name_txt,   overwrite = TRUE,   extended = FALSE,   erase_bin = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Run CENTURY simulations and load results into the R session â€” century_run
text: pathname character string valid path folder. schedule character string name valid schedule file (extension '.sch') name_bin character string name give output '.bin' file. name_lis character string name give output '.lis' ASCII file. name_txt character string specifying name ASCII text (extension '.txt') file contains, single column, name fields extract results. overwrite logical, set TRUE file already exists, overwrite; set FALSE file exists, stop error message. extended character flag "Y" "N" decide whether computation corresponds extended one (see CENTURY manual, section 6-1, details). erase_bin logical, set TRUE (default) '.bin' file results CENTURY simulation erased calculations done. verbose logical, set TRUE (default) information execution printed screen.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution â€” dirichlet_params
Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution â€” dirichlet_params
text: mean numerical vector, length variance, containing mean values component Dirichlet distribution. variance numerical vector, one non-NA element variance value.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution â€” dirichlet_params
text: corresponding alpha values Dirichlet distribution. alpha values negative variance decreased. warning issued case.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution â€” dirichlet_params
text: Input mean vector must contain mean values component Dirichlet distribution. one value missing (signaled NA) calculated sum mean values. turn, one variance value must introduced elements variance vector must NA.

title: Calculate parameters required in a Dirichlet distribution â€” dirichlet_params
code: # Mean and variance values as input. m <- c(.3, .23,.27, .2) v <- c(NA, .1, NA, NA) alpha <- dirichlet_params(m, v)  # Calculate mean values from alpha. print(alpha/sum(alpha)) #> [1] 0.30 0.23 0.27 0.20  # Calculate variance values from alpha. alpha0 <- sum(alpha) beta <- alpha / alpha0 print(beta*(1-beta)/(1+alpha0)) #> [1] 0.11857708 0.10000000 0.11129305 0.09034444

title: Split character string in two parts â€” splitin2
code: # See the difference when 'input_type' changes value. str(splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data")) #> Error in splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data"): could not find function "splitin2" str(splitin2("45 'This'", "title")) #> Error in splitin2("45 'This'", "title"): could not find function "splitin2"  # We set 'remove_quotes' to FALSE. str(splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data", FALSE)) #> Error in splitin2("4.5 'This'", "data", FALSE): could not find function "splitin2" str(splitin2("45 'This'", "title", FALSE)) #> Error in splitin2("45 'This'", "title", FALSE): could not find function "splitin2"

code: # Example list with two elements. x <- list()  df <- data.frame(runif(11), c(paste0("cultra(", 1:7, ")"), paste0("clteff(", 1:4, ")"))) colnames(df) <- NULL x[[1]] <- list(label = "E1", title = "Example1", df = df)  df <- data.frame(runif(11), c(paste0("cultra(", 1:7, ")"), paste0("clteff(", 1:4, ")"))) colnames(df) <- NULL x[[2]] <- list(label = "E1", title = "Example1", df = df)  # Create temporary path. path <- tempdir() write_100(x, path, "cult.100")

title: Save to disk a *.sch CENTURY file â€” write_schedule
text: Nothing.

title: Save to disk a *.sch CENTURY file â€” write_schedule

what: Write data to a CENTURY site file. â€” write_site
title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. â€” write_site
text: write_site allows users create input site files (extension '.100') CENTURY soil model.

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. â€” write_site
code: write_site(   x,   pathname = pathname,   filename = filename,   ndigits = 6,   sep = "    ",   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. â€” write_site
text: x list many elements events needed. pathname character string valid path folder. filename character string specifying name file, must include extension '.100'. overwrite logical, set FALSE (default), code stop file already exists. set TRUE, previous file overwritten.

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. â€” write_site
text: writing successful, returns nothing.

title: Write data to a CENTURY site file. â€” write_site
code: # Reads one of the site files provided with the package. pathname <- system.file("extdata/4.forest",  package = "Rcentury") filename <- "duke.100" x <- read_site(pathname, filename)  # Create temporary path. path <- tempdir() write_site(x, path, "duke.100")

what: Write CENTURY weather file â€” write_weather
title: Write CENTURY weather file â€” write_weather
text: write_weather takes input data.frame containing weather data writes '*.wth' CENTURY file disk.

title: Write CENTURY weather file â€” write_weather
code: write_weather(   df,   pathname = pathname,   filename = filename,   overwrite = FALSE,   sep = "      ",   ndigits = 6 )

title: Write CENTURY weather file â€” write_weather
text: df data.frame containing weather data (precipitation, maximum minimum temperature). overwrite logical indicating whether overwrite 'fileout' already exists disk. Default 'TRUE'. sep character string separate columns 'fileout'. Default empty character string length 7. ndigits numeric indicating number decimal digits output file. Default 3. fileout character string name (without extension) weather file created. wd character string name valid directory save weather file. Default local folder. verbose logical indicating whether print informative messages. Default 'TRUE'.

title: Write CENTURY weather file â€” write_weather
text: NULL returned fileout written disk.

title: Write CENTURY weather file â€” write_weather
text: input data.frame pivoted long wide format fit CENTURY requirements.

title: Write CENTURY weather file â€” write_weather
code: df<- data.frame(month = rep(1:12, 2),   year = rep(c(2020, 2021), each = 12),   prec = runif(24)*500 + 100,   tmin = rnorm(24, mean = 5),   tmax = rnorm(24, mean = 15)) century_weather(df, "nothing") #> Error in century_weather(df, "nothing"): could not find function "century_weather"
